etymologies: mid 18th century (denoting a set of three writing tablets hinged or tied together): from tri- ‘three’, on the pattern of diptych

definitions: a picture or relief carving on three panels, typically hinged together side by side and used as an altarpiece
shortDefinitions: picture or relief carving on three panels

definitions: a set of three associated artistic, literary, or musical works intended to be appreciated together

examples.text: a triptych on the theme of the holocaust
his triptych of one-act operas is unfairly neglected

shortDefinitions: set of three associated artistic, literary, or musical works intended to be appreciated together
